_comment: Created by ianb on 08/06/2015 16:33:04 using v2.6
title: How long do patients have to wait to see someone at the GP surgery?
analysis_commentary: Over a quarter (26%) of patients in the last full finacial year measured (2012/13) had to wait 15 minutes or longer to see the GP or nurse after their appointment time, which hasn't dramatically changed compared to the preceding three years and subsequent time periods suggests no changes in this trend. An equivalent proportion of patients (25% 2012/13) also said that they felt they had to wait a bit too long and a further 9% said that they had to wait far too long. Again in the three proceeding years these proportions were not very much different. Although between 2009/10 and 2012/13 there has been a decrease of 5% in the proportion of patients who said that they don't normally have to wait too long.
